auto_merge.commit_message:
Problem: Option metadata like list of valid values for an option and
option flags are not listed in the `options.lua` file and are instead
manually defined in C, which means option metadata is split between
several places.

Solution: Put metadata such as list of valid values for an option and
option flags in `options.lua`, and autogenerate the corresponding C
variables and enums.

Supersedes #28659

Co-authored-by: glepnir <glephunter@gmail.com>
auto_merge.commit_title: refactor(options): autogenerate valid values and flag enums for options (#31089)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: Option metadata like list of valid values for an option and option flags are not listed in the `options.lua` file and are instead manually defined in C, which means option metadata is split between several places.

Solution: Put metadata such as list of valid values for an option and option flags in `options.lua`, and autogenerate the corresponding C variables and enums.

Supersedes #28659

comment_data.body:
`Noneu` is a bit strange. I think `NoneU` is better.
```suggestion
        Block = 5,
        Insert = 6,
        All = 4,
        Onemore = 8,
        None = 16,
        NoneU = 32,
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9529,6 +9733,15 @@ return {
       abbreviation = 've',
       cb = 'did_set_virtualedit',
       defaults = { if_true = '' },
+      values = { 'block', 'insert', 'all', 'onemore', 'none', 'NONE' },
+      flags = {
+        block = 5,
+        insert = 6,
+        all = 4,
+        onemore = 8,
+        none = 16,
+        noneu = 32,

comment_data.body: `option_vars.generated.h` isn't equivalent to a `_defs` header, as it contains `EXTERN` variables. It should therefore also not be included in `option_defs.h`. Including it in `option_vars.h` and then adding a `NOLINT(build/include_defs)` is better.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -899,7 +899,8 @@ def CheckIncludes(filename, lines, error):
                     not name.endswith('_defs.h') and
                     not name.endswith('h.inline.generated.h') and
                     not name.endswith('_defs.generated.h') and
-                    not name.endswith('_enum.generated.h')):
+                    not name.endswith('_enum.generated.h') and
+                    not name.endswith('_vars.generated.h')):

@@ -899,7 +899,8 @@ def CheckIncludes(filename, lines, error):
                     not name.endswith('_defs.h') and
                     not name.endswith('h.inline.generated.h') and
                     not name.endswith('_defs.generated.h') and
-                    not name.endswith('_enum.generated.h')):
+                    not name.endswith('_enum.generated.h') and
+                    not name.endswith('_vars.generated.h')):

@@ -138,6 +144,91 @@ map_w('static ' .. hashfun)
 
 opt_map_fd:close()
 
+vars_w('// IWYU pragma: private, include "nvim/option_defs.h"')

comment_data.body: The colon after `algorithm` is now missing in the cmdline completion of `:set diffopt=`. The colon needs to be added here, and then something needs to be done in `gen_options.lua` to avoid syntax error in the generated file.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2077,6 +2140,25 @@ return {
       abbreviation = 'dip',
       cb = 'did_set_diffopt',
       defaults = { if_true = 'internal,filler,closeoff' },
+      values = {
+        'filler',
+        'context:',
+        'iblank',
+        'icase',
+        'iwhite',
+        'iwhiteall',
+        'iwhiteeol',
+        'horizontal',
+        'vertical',
+        'closeoff',
+        'hiddenoff',
+        'foldcolumn:',
+        'followwrap',
+        'internal',
+        'indent-heuristic',
+        'linematch:',
+        { 'algorithm', { 'myers', 'minimal', 'patience', 'histogram' } },

comment_data.body: Move this comment to `options.lua`, and change the `p_briopt_values` in the comment in `briopt_check()` to `opt_briopt_values`.
Ditto, and change `p_dip_algorithm_values` in `diffopt_changed()` as well.
Maybe this `Also used for 'viewoptions'` comment should also be moved to `options.lua`?

comment_regular_data.body: `NOLINT(build/include_defs)` doesn't seem to work. I remember this being the case the last time I tried to do that as well
Noticed that `culopt` and `wim` flags weren't moved yet, so moved those as well
